title: Florence Griffith Joyner
summary: Florence Delorez Griffith Joyner[6] (born Florence Delorez Griffith;[2] December 21, 1959 â€“ September 21, 1998), also known as Flo-Jo, was an American track and field athlete. She set world records in 1988 for both the 100 m and 200 m. During the late 1980s she became a popular figure due to both her record-setting athleticism and eclectic personal style.
